briefdescription.para: Provide the primitive to iterate on a list Note: the loop is unsafe and thus __sn should not be removed.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on a sys_slist_t to iterate on
A sys_snode_t pointer to peek each node of the list

briefdescription.para: Provide the primitive to iterate on a list, from a node in the list Note: the loop is unsafe and thus __sn should not be removed.

detaileddescription.para: This and other SYS_SLIST_*() macros are not thread safe.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on a sys_slist_t to iterate on
A sys_snode_t pointer to peek each node of the list it contains the starting node, or NULL to start from the head

briefdescription.para: Provide the primitive to safely iterate on a list Note: __sn can be removed, it will not break the loop.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on a sys_slist_t to iterate on
A sys_snode_t pointer to peek each node of the list
A sys_snode_t pointer for the loop to run safely

briefdescription.para: Provide the primitive to iterate on a list under a container Note: the loop is unsafe and thus __cn should not be detached.

detaileddescription.para:
User MUST add the loop statement curly braces enclosing its own code: SYS_SLIST_FOR_EACH_CONTAINER(l, c, n) { <user code> }
__sl
A pointer on a sys_slist_t to iterate on
__cn
A pointer to peek each entry of the list
__n
The field name of sys_node_t within the container struct

briefdescription.para: Provide the primitive to safely iterate on a list under a container Note: __cn can be detached, it will not break the loop.

detaileddescription.para:
User MUST add the loop statement curly braces enclosing its own code: SYS_SLIST_FOR_EACH_NODE_SAFE(l, c, cn, n) { <user code> }
__sl
A pointer on a sys_slist_t to iterate on
__cn
A pointer to peek each entry of the list
__cns
A pointer for the loop to run safely
__n
The field name of sys_node_t within the container struct

briefdescription.para: Initialize a list.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on the list to initialize

briefdescription.para: Peek the first node from the list.

parameterdescription.para: A point on the list to peek the first node from

simplesect.para: A pointer on the first node of the list (or NULL if none)

briefdescription.para: Peek the last node from the list.

parameterdescription.para: A point on the list to peek the last node from

simplesect.para: A pointer on the last node of the list (or NULL if none)

briefdescription.para: Test if the given list is empty.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on the list to test

simplesect.para: a boolean, true if it's empty, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Peek the next node from current node, node is not NULL.

detaileddescription.para: Faster then sys_slist_peek_next() if node is known not to be NULL.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on the node where to peek the next node

simplesect.para: a pointer on the next node (or NULL if none)

briefdescription.para: Peek the next node from current node.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on the node where to peek the next node

simplesect.para: a pointer on the next node (or NULL if none)

briefdescription.para: Prepend a node to the given list.

detaileddescription.para: This and other sys_slist_*() functions are not thread safe.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on the list to affect
A pointer on the node to prepend

briefdescription.para: Append a node to the given list.

detaileddescription.para: This and other sys_slist_*() functions are not thread safe.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on the list to affect
A pointer on the node to append

briefdescription.para: Append a list to the given list.

detaileddescription.para: Append a singly-linked, NULL-terminated list consisting of nodes containing the pointer to the next node as the first element of a node, to list. This and other sys_slist_*() functions are not thread safe.
FIXME: Why are the element parameters void *?

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on the list to affect
A pointer to the first element of the list to append
A pointer to the last element of the list to append

briefdescription.para: merge two slists, appending the second one to the first

detaileddescription.para: When the operation is completed, the appending list is empty. This and other sys_slist_*() functions are not thread safe.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on the list to affect
A pointer to the list to append.

briefdescription.para: Insert a node to the given list.

detaileddescription.para: This and other sys_slist_*() functions are not thread safe.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on the list to affect
A pointer on the previous node
A pointer on the node to insert

briefdescription.para: Fetch and remove the first node of the given list.

detaileddescription.para: List must be known to be non-empty. This and other sys_slist_*() functions are not thread safe.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on the list to affect

simplesect.para: A pointer to the first node of the list

briefdescription.para: Fetch and remove the first node of the given list.

detaileddescription.para: This and other sys_slist_*() functions are not thread safe.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on the list to affect

simplesect.para: A pointer to the first node of the list (or NULL if empty)

briefdescription.para: Remove a node.

detaileddescription.para: This and other sys_slist_*() functions are not thread safe.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on the list to affect
A pointer on the previous node (can be NULL, which means the node is the list's head)
A pointer on the node to remove

briefdescription.para: Find and remove a node from a list.

detaileddescription.para: This and other sys_slist_*() functions are not thread safe.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer on the list to affect
A pointer on the node to remove from the list

briefdescription.para: Single-linked list implementation.

detaileddescription.para: Single-linked list implementation using inline macros/functions. This API is not thread safe, and thus if a list is used across threads, calls to functions must be protected with synchronization primitives.
